title: Former XU standout named Kentucky State coach
text:
Former XU standout named Kentucky State coach Darnell Williams takes reins of Thorobreds Post to Facebook Former XU standout named Kentucky State coach Darnell Williams takes reins of Thorobreds  //cin.ci/1RrDedJ   Xavier Sports   10:58 p.m. EDT October 5, 2015 
Xavier's Darnell Williams moves in to rebound during a game against Toledo at the Cincinnati Gardens in 1999.   
Former Xavier star Darnell Williams on Monday took a big step forward in his career when he was named Kentucky State's men's basketball coach. 
The Division II school promoted Williams to position after he spent three seasons as a Thorobreds assistant. 
"It's a great opportunity," Williams said in a statement . "It's great to be able to take over a program that has had such a great and successful history. We're going to try to get the program back to where it was." 
The Thorobreds went 9-18 last season and 7-12 in the Southern Intercollegiate Athletic Conference. 
In 2013-14, the team posted a 15-14 overall record and made a deep run in the SIAC Championship Tournament. Kentucky State won its first two conference games before being outsted by eventual champion Tuskegee. 
Williams helped lead the Thorobreds to a 15-12 record (11-6 SIAC) in 2012-13. 
"I'm very optimistic," Williams said of the upcoming season . "We've got a young team, and we're a little undersized. We're going to have to work hard, but I think we're going to be the better conditioned team. My goal is for this to be not only one of the most well-conditioned teams, but one of the most disciplined teams, both offensively and defensively." 
Williams came to KSU after coaching for the Cincinnati Public School System since 2003. During his time there, Williams held several head and assistant basketball coaching positions, his most recent being assistant basketball coach at Withrow High School. He also was the head basketball coach of the AAU 17 and under Queen City Prophets, which won a state title in 2010. 
Williams played shooting guard and small forward at Xavier University from 1995-99. He was named to the Atlantic 10 all-rookie Team in 1995-1996, first team All-Atlantic 10 in 1997-98, and to the Atlantic 10 all-tournament team in 1998. He is a member of Xavier's 1,000 Point Club and was selected as an honorable mention All-American in 1997-1998. 
After receiving his Bachelor of Communication Arts from Xavier in 2000, Williams was given the opportunity to try out for the Sacramento Kings. He also played in the CBL/IBL league, and, in continuation of his professional career, Williams played in several leagues overseas including Turkey, Austria, France and Venezuela. 
In Venezuela, he won a championship with Marinos de Oriente and was named Rookie of the Year and to the All-Defensive Team in 2003-2005. 
Williams received his master's degree in sports management from Columbia Southern University in 2009. 
He and his wife Brigitte reside in Frankfort with their daughter Dorien, son Cameron, and grandson Cameron Jr.  //cin.ci/1RrDedJ Most Popular
